page.title: 04Hardwick Dairy Farm.
page.content: Old Hardwick is typical of the many dairy farms in the area. The farm currently has 115 milking cows which are a Friesan/Holstein cross which give a better milk yield. The cows are milked twice daily, at 6am.and 3.30pm. They are milked at a rate of 60 an hour and while milking is in progress a computer allocates an individual ration of food to each cow, depending on it's needs. In the winter the cows are all housed indoors in an open area rather than in pens. The farm has it's own nursery and produces about 80 calves a year. Heifer calves are kept for replacement stock while bull calves are sold at market after 2 weeks. At present they have a 10 month old bull which they bred and are hoping to use as a replacement.
